• there is evidence of acute renal failure - increasing urea and creatinine levels.
• there is severe thrombocytopenia (<50,000/mm3).

ntepartum haemorrhage of unknown origin 
• This is a common problem in obstetrics, where APH occurs with no evidence of abruptio placentae, placenta
praevia, or cervical or vaginal (local) causes.
